a.style: color: white; font-family: Verdana; text-decoration: none;

a.title: Bylaws & Policies for Board of Ed

li.a: Bylaws & Policies for Board of Ed

span.p: As a reminder, the Lyndhurst School District will continue to be closed. On Monday, March 23rd, Governor Murphy stated that schools would be closed for a "long and extended period of time.” Later in the week, the governor stated that he would reassess the state of COVID-19 in New Jersey and make a decision in consultation with the New Jersey Department of Health and the New Jersey Department of Education on or around Friday, April 17, 2020.
As stated in a letter sent home last week, we will be sending out weekly updates, at minimum.

Our entire staff continues to do a phenomenal job in providing educational opportunities for our children. In the near future, a survey will be going out to address any general concerns that you may have. In the meantime, I urge to follow chain of command protocol and reach out to your child’s building, starting with their teacher, if you have any questions/concerns. I can assure you that all of us are sympathetic to the current situation, and we will all do our best to accommodate any issues that may arise.

ul.li: Flexible Instruction- March 30th through April 3rd- (Monday through Friday)
Flexible Instruction- April 6th through April 9th- (Monday through Thursday)
Spring Break- Friday, April 10th through Friday, April 17th

span.p: Students will return to Flexible Instruction on Monday, April 20th, unless we are directed by the New Jersey Department of Education/New Jersey Department of Health to return to a traditional school setting.
